H0.text: when does closure of the ductus arteriosus occur. Immediately after the first cry

H1.text: when does closure of the ductus arteriosus occur. During the first week of life

H2.text: when does closure of the ductus arteriosus occur. At the onset of pulmonary respiration

H3.text: when does closure of the ductus arteriosus occur. birth

A4.text: Immediately after birth, the levels of both PGE2 and the EP4 receptors reduce significantly, allowing for closure of the DA and establishment of normal postnatal circulation.

A5.text: Upon closure at birth, it becomes the ligamentum arteriosum.
